This is a fun little game. The pluses are great artwork and very fun story themes. I say story themes because the theme is fun (e.g. the dragon trapped in a body of a girl) but the actual progressions of the stories are a bit luck luster. The gameplay itself is mostly boring. You can have a little strategy to think a couple of moves ahead, but it gets boring and tedious quickly.

There is a challenge mode that unlocks at the end. I thought that there'd be a big boss at the end or some reward, but it's simply more grinding.

The "punish" mode is fun. It's fun to explore all the options. That the artwork is censored is a bummer. There is a hack to uncensor it, but then you are stuck with an old version. Plus the DLC content doesn't get uncensored.

The stories are all very short. I thought it was one big plot, but you get 8 separate short stories. As you can expect, not much happens in most of them. Sometimes the girl is put in an inescapable position, sometimes the girl just wants to sleep with you for not much reason (actually they all want that). One interesting story with a bit of plot development was the one about the two Egyptian ladyfriends who were in a power struggle.
But I think Martha's story was the most interesting, because of its tensions between Martha and the bishop and within Martha herself. Also, she gets to be chained up in the end! It also has the best background music imo.
The match-3 gameplay is fun with lots of skills to choose from. But it's really annoying when the enemy puts a negative status on a gem that you wanted to do a combo on. So I ended up always using Freeze (1-turn enemy action delay), and Holy Light (remove all negative status gems).

143791398.review:
ENG:
Together with Wish, Mirror is the classic match-3 par excellence intended for an adult audience, however, unlike the other title, this one requires a decensoring patch to be downloaded and applied separately.
The game essentially consists of a series of mini visual novels, one for each girl, separated by context and story, interspersed with match-3 game sections in what I can say is its best interpretation between mechanics and execution, becoming gradually more difficult and complex, adding power ups on one side and malus on the other, as the game progresses.
The scenes, although quite simple and static, are decidedly well done and also relatively interactive!
For its cost, Mirror is an absolutely recommended title, especially for lovers of the genre.

[spoiler]Personal note: including the DLCs, which are as good as the main game by the way, Daisy is the best girl here, followed by Mafrecca, Lin and Ebony.[/spoiler]

____


ITA:
Insieme a Wish, Mirror è il classico match-3 per eccellenza destinato ad un pubblico adulto, tuttavia, a differenza dell'altro titolo, questo necessita di una patch decensurante da scaricare e applicare separatamente.
Il gioco sostanzialmente si costituisce in una serie di mini visual novel, una per ogni ragazza, separate tra loro per contesto e storia, intervallate da sezioni di gioco match-3 in quella che posso dire essere la sua migliore interpretazione tra meccaniche ed esecuzione, diventando via via più difficile e complesso, aggiungendo power up da una parte e malus dall'altra, mano a mano che si prosegue nel gioco.
Le scene, per quanto abbastanza semplici e statiche, sono decisamente ben realizzate e pure relativamente interattive!
Per il suo costo, Mirror è un titolo assolutamente da consigliare, specialmente agli amanti del genere.

[spoiler]Nota personale: considerando anche i DLC, che sono altrettanto buoni tra l'altro, Daisy è la best girl qui, seguita da Mafrecca, Lin e Ebony.[/spoiler]

Gallo Pinto Costarricense

Ingredientes
3 cucharadas de aceite de canola
1/4 cebolla picada
1/2 pimiento verde (o rojo) en cuadraditos
3 tazas de frijoles rojos o negros, cocidos
3 tazas de arroz blanco, cocido
1. pizca de Sal
2 cucharadas de culantro picado

Instrucciones
1. Calienta el aceite en una sartén grande y fríe la cebolla y el pimiento hasta que estén suaves.
2. Agrega los frijoles, bien escurridos, y fríe de tres a cinco minutos. Agrega un poco del caldo de cocción, si ves que están quedando muy secos.
3. Incorpora el arroz y sigue friendo unos tres minutos más agregando un poco más de caldo de frijoles para que el gallo pinto no quede muy seco y finalmente adorna con culantro picado.

¡Pura Vida!

141197078.review:
I won't lie: I originally avoided playing this because I thought it was just a meme of a hentai game. Then I was gifted it by a Steam Friend, and a few months (years?) picked it up when I became interested in the puzzle play aspect. 

The Match-3 Puzzle game is addictive, and honestly really fun. It's not as good as say, [i]Huniepop[/i] (the measure by which I compare all Hentai Match-3 puzzle games) but much better than [i]Purino Party.[/i] 
At the very, very beginning I felt a little overwhelmed, but it's super easy to pick up and can be pretty fast paced and enjoyable.

The hentai aspect is mediocre. The Live2D animation is alright, especially for the time (2018), but pretty awkward/clunky by today's standards. Some of the expressions that are pulled are [i]not[/i] attractive.
The voice acting is hit or miss and probably up to preference. Some of the girls are doing their best, others sound very grating, especially during puzzle play. [spoiler] Or during the hentai scene where their lines will be cut off randomly mid-moan. [/spoiler]

I was honestly impressed by the scenarios though. I know they were cliche and took a backseat to the puzzle play/hentai, but quite a few of them took turns I wasn't expecting. The writing/translation was a bit awkward in parts however, which I sort of expected.

I'd recommend for the puzzle play. Also, this game is BONKERS CHEAP when it's on sale.

140950426.review:
Antes de empezar con la reseña me gustaría aclarar algo extremadamente importante, nuevamente vuelvo a hacer una reseña por el aspecto moral detrás de esto, de eso hablare mas adelante.

Lo que quiero decir es que, si bien el juego en cuestión es muy bueno, hay ciertas decisiones empresariales en los siguientes juegos que son basura y que, sin embargo, pueden ser incentivadas por el gobierno, el estudio es chino, de eso hablare mas en profundidad en la segunda mitad, dependiendo de la razón detrás de esa decisión, esta reseña seguirá siendo positiva, o negativa.

Las mecánicas son bastante simples, una copia de candy crush, donde le haces daño a las chicas en un combate donde, mientras mas críticos haces, mas se les rompe la ropa, y después de los combates consigues dinero para comprar mas habilidades o mejorar el daño de cada efecto, bastante sencillo, pero aun con esa sencillez, recuerdo estar rompiéndome la cabeza con algunas etapas donde necesitaba conseguir algo concreto, misteriosamente un juego así de simple consiguió que me ponga a pensar con las 2 cabezas, lo cual esta bastante bien.

Los combates contra las chicas van por etapas, los 4 primeros son para conseguir pequeños fragmentos de historia, el quinto es para desbloquear el modo libre, donde tienes las escenas de sexo, que aunque sean bastante simples, se disfrutan bastante. Dentro de las escenas de sexo puedes elegir 2 rutas, las de placer y dolor, las de placer suelen estar relacionados con el final bueno, mientras que las de dolor son todo lo contrario.
Personalmente no entiendo como podría gustarle a alguien las rutas de dolor, hay algunas que no están mal, como las de la chica zombie, desbloquean escenas hermosas para la galería y no son tan malas, pero hay otras que son espantosas.
En lo personal, optaría ir exclusivamente por las rutas de placer, o ir por los logros, teniendo a la mano un poco de clorox para echarse en los ojos.

Sobre la historia de los personajes, ofrece 8 pequeñas historias con personajes muy variados, con el DLC lost shards son 12, y los diseños son sublimes, no resulta dificil ver en que se inspiraron para crear cada historia, desde personajes inspirados en cultura japonesa y china, hasta egipcia e incluso medieval europea.

A pesar de todo el odio que hay en asía con otras culturas, no he notado que traten de atacar la cultura de otros países, mucho menos la propia, lo saben tratar muy bien, y personalmente me he llegado a dejar atraer por algunas de las pequeñas historias que cuentan.

El arte por su parte es hermoso, me cuesta trabajo encontrar algo de lo que quejarme, quizás el hecho de que faltan ilustraciones mas “light”, de algunos personajes como la elfa obscura.
Aun así, hay algunas que incluso me atrevería a usar de fondo de pantalla, nada erótico, pero tu sabes de que historia son, recuerdo las ilustraciones de la monja y la chica dragón, ilustraciones preciosas.

Con respecto a la censura, parece ser cosa de Steam, los desarrolladores lanzaron en su momento un parche para quitarla que esta disponible en Internet, no hay tanto problema, y de hecho, yo prescindí de usar el parche, la historia de los personajes me mantuvo lo suficientemente atrapado para no necesitarlo. Lo que si eche en falta, es una traducción al español del DLC lost shards, que por mas que busque, no encontré nada, pero aun con eso, la historia de las chicas del dlc me mantuvo interesado lo suficiente como para ir a buscar una traducción, para poder entender la historia de un juego así… y nadie hizo una traducción, me imagino porque…

Con respecto al precio, esta bajisimo para la calidad del producto ¿que esperas flaco? ¿que te ponga una escopeta? Le comente de la ruta de dolor de la chica japonesa a shadman y me dijo que parara, que esa historia estaba mas perturbada que sus dibujos, también se lo comente al doom slayer y ahora confunde a los humanos con demonios, y de un rincón salio slaanesh, pero después dijo que eso era demasiado para ella.

Ahora, dejando de lado el humor barato, aquí empieza la polémica, este juego, originalmente fue fruto de un crowfunding, Sacaron el mirror party y otro crowfunding para conseguir dinero para el mirror 2, en un inicio no habia contenido erótico, salvo por un solo DLC gratuito donde si habia una pequeña escena era una profundización en la historia de los personajes… pero la ultima actualización fue el 17 de enero de 2023, y el 9 de marzo publicaron un comunicado donde decian que estaban en quiebra.

Aquí es cuando las cosas se ponen raras, en un inicio, de la nada, la empresa dijo “buscar alejarse de los juegos nsfw porque les hacen ver como poco profesionales”, y que por eso optaron por no sacar contenido nsfw en el segundo juego.

Tengo mis hipótesis, o el equipo no tuvo en cuenta a la comunidad, o fue el gobierno chino. El gobierno chino ha estado censurando muchos juegos a lo largo de la historia, en especial porque se basan en junzi, el superhombre de Confusio, vease PD.H. Durruty M. (2011). El Despertar del Neoconfusionismo en China. El impacto en el discurso politico del partido comunista chino. 

Primeramente, esa ideología busca “un hombre fuerte y de buenos valores”, teniendo en cuenta las ideas de la época (alrededor del siglo 3), por poner un símil, la homosexualidad, y ser afeminado siendo hombre era visto como debilidad. En 2021, china creo talleres para que los hombres “sean mas masculinos”, vease BBC Monitoring 2021, China: la cruzada del gobierno para educar a los niños para que sean "más varoniles".

Resurgió esa ideología, China ha censurado incluso a venti, de genshin impact, argumentando que “es influencia dañina para los jóvenes”, vease Nintenduo, (2021), China censura a personajes masculinos ‘afeminados’ en juegos y cine.

Es importante resaltar que eso de “influencia dañina”, es porque creen que la ficción también afecta a la realidad, por eso sus constantes ataques al k-pop y al anime, ademas de, naturalmente, odio a Japón y Corea del sur.
Esto termino de demostrarse cuando, haciendo honor a la creencia de que los videojuegos “no son verdadera tecnología”, decidieron limitar el uso de horas, y después aumentar los impuestos a las desarrolladoras.

Ahora, toda esta introducción viene por una sencilla razón, China cree que el contenido nsfw es perjudicial, y siempre ha tratado de joderlo, ejemplos abundan, la decisión del estudio de “ser una empresa profesional”, coincide justo con la caída de evergrade, que desato una crisis económica nunca antes vista en China, y que obligo a china a presionar a los estudios de videojuegos.

Lo siguiente fue dicho por ellos mismos, el 9 de marzo declararon que recibieron “amenazas de organismos gubernamentales”, antes de eso, decidieron lanzar un juego llamado novastela island, bajo el nombre de “nova studios”, después dieron reembolso completo, pero se hizo a través de alipay, una aplicación china de transferencias, en vez de steam, y se reportaron casos de robo sin confirmar.

Esto ya se ha visto antes, con el mismo honkai impact, que se conectaba a un servidor aparte en la versión de steam, causando el error PAGE_FAULD_IN_NONPAGED_AREA al pedir archivos al kernel (nucleo del sistema) en masa, y después UNEXPECTED_KERNEL_MODE_TRAP al forzar el envió de los datos a través a los servidores por el protocolo TCP, vease @fastar, gettr 2021. Sistema anticheats de Genshin impact y Honkai impact revientan el sistema operativo.

El que ellos mismos confirmen que justo en la fecha correcta recibieron amenazas de organismos gubernamentales es extremadamente sospechoso, en lo personal, me inclino a pensar que fue el gobierno chino que primero, intento presionar a los estudios, al ver que necesitaba mas dinero, presiono a las empresas para obligarlas a hacer algún favor a cambio de no quebrar, y posteriormente le termino de dar la ultima puñalada al estudio.

El contexto actual en China es bastante diferente, pero durante la caída del estudio, las cosas fueron así.

136371730.review:
[h1]The Japanese can be weird[/h1]
Mirror reminds me of the Flash games era, where everything was done with minimum amount of time, minimum amount of money and in most cases – minimum amount of effort.
Was there any effort put into Mirror? YYYeeeaaahhh… I guess. I believe there was. Shame there wasn’t enough of it. At least not enough to polish it.
This is not my major concern though. My major concern was the quote unquote “story” that was put into it and the… very odd… Japanese style of narrative full of weird fetishes such as urinating at someone or straight-up giving birth.
That’s a red flag for me and if it sounds revolting for you, stay away from Mirror.


[h1]Sounds good doesn’t it?[/h1]
No, no it does not.
I want to start this review by taking a look at the game’s audio side. It’s… not great. And in places where it is worse than “not great”… it’s simply unbearable.
First of all, let’s talk about how nobody gave enough of a damn to check if the audio is played correctly throughout the game. When you have a simple connect 3 game I would expect of it to be at least playable without the sounds overlapping one another when a lot is happening on the board. There were moments where I was just deafened by how loud the sounds got because 3…4… or maybe even 8 of them were played on top of each other, completely destroying my eardrums. Not pleasant, that’s for sure.

Mirror has a unique song for each of the girls you encounter and most of them are at least decent. Nothing to write home about, but at least it holds good enough level to earn a praise. What does not earn such compliment is the very rest of the game. I am very, very disappointed in the amount of dialogue each character has. Let’s forget about the fact that there is not a single male character audio in the game, despite males making for a majority of this title [i](lol)[/i] while every single female character has a voice actress. Let’s focus on the fact that each of them has about… ONE LINE per each different action. So given that they have 5-6 actions each… that’s five or six lines per actress and god will you hear that on repeat during gameplay.
 
Was visiting Fiverr too difficult? It feels just… so bizarre to have every second or third line actually voiced while all the rest is just plain text. I’m pretty sure there’s tons of male voice actors who would be more than happy to read the lines. Guess someone wasn’t as happy to pay them for such work.

There are more sounds in the game and let’s just say that while connect 3 part of the title is completely fine, whatever is connected to the story-part… wow is it unfinished. Bad quality, repeated or looped single sound… tragic transitions… I was very unhappy with it and after a few chapters I completely gave up on reading or listening. Just skipped to the next connect 3 part.


[h1]Wait, this game has story?[/h1]
You might have noticed that I mentioned story part a few times by now. Yeah, Mirror has a “story” which introduces new girls & boys to you through something barely resembling a dive into other people’s consciousness. You mostly dive into the minds of the guys [i](go figure)[/i] who encounter their female counterparts across few very different situations. They are all over the place with their timelines so it’s best not to look for too many similarities between them.
Are the stories any good?
No.

Simply put, no.
Starting from the complete disconnection from anything that could ever possibly happen even in some fucked up porn scenarios, through the game pretending to give you choices which obviously do not matter at all, ending on the fact that wow are some of them fetishized with stuff that isn’t really… let’s call it vanilla.
Nothing have prepared me for what I was about to witness with Mirror. I do not know why I have purchased this game but given that I was a fan of HuniePop series, I decided to give this title a try and it was a giant mistake. I am not ready for whatever KAGAMI WORKS had in store for me.

There is not much I could spoil you, even if I laid down the entirety of it… but let’s just say that sacrificial rituals to the dead and to some… sort of Cthulhu during a sexual intercourse… wow is it a lot to handle. Burning someone with candles, suffocating them or almost beating to death? It is part of Mirror but it is also something that is WAAAAAAAAY too much for me. I would call the cops, but if that’s your thing… I dunno. Go crazy.

There isn’t much to look at through the entire thing and frankly… while I can’t talk about the game’s visual style simply because it may be a matter of taste… I really keep wondering why I bought this title. Because sure as hell it wasn’t for one-handed sessions… it wasn’t because of the story, as that was disappointing to say the least… it was not for the eye-candy cause there is not much of it… it also wasn’t due to the connect 3 part… as it is not too groundbreaking neither… then… why did I even bother to play it?


[h1]No identity[/h1]
Mirror suffers from the very bad case of having no identity. Imagine HuniePop or HuniePop 2. Now imagine it being buggy, rather not too well planned, with revolting story and lazily put together sounds and gameplay, with barely no redeeming qualities and no memorable characters or even features. Congratz. The thing you just imagined is Mirror.
I know this game is practically free… but it’s still nothing I could recommend to anyone. You really are better off playing something else and if you are really insisting on playing a connect 3 game with NSFW part to it… just go play HuniePop. You’ll make yourself a huge favor.

131643804.review:
Mirror is a popular and addictive match-3 puzzle game that has been around for several years. The game's objective is to match gems in order to progress through levels and earn points. This in turn allows you to unlock CGs.

One of the positives of Mirror is its anime artstyle and vibrant graphics. The game's art style is can be stiff and quite jarring, making it easy to play for a bit, unlock a character and log off. Additionally, the game offers a variety of levels and challenges, and replayable story moments for achievement hunters.

However, the game also has some negative aspects. One is that the game is heavily reliant on power ups. To progress through levels quickly, players are often prompted to purchase extra moves, lives, or boosters. This can make the game feel grindy.

Another negative is that the game's difficulty level can be inconsistent. Some levels are easy to pass, while others are nearly impossible without the use of boosters or power-ups. This can be frustrating for players who are trying to progress through the game to get the CGs.

Lastly, the game's repetition can be tedious over time. Even though the game offers a variety of levels, the gameplay remains the same, match gems to progress. This can lead to player feeling bored after playing for a while.

Mirror is a fun and addictive game that offers a lot of content. However, the reliance on power-ups, inconsistent difficulty level, and repetition can make the experience frustrating for some players. If you're looking for a casual and colorful puzzle game, Mirror can be a great option, but be prepared to encounter some annoyances along the way. Another good Alternative is Wish which has a similiar but more refined anime artstyle.

129907631.review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

129423821.review:
This review is specially made for those who like to get all the achievements (minor spoilers ahead).

[b]Description:[/b]  
Mirror is a very HARDCORE Hentai match 3 game with several different characters, with different attacks and abilities  that you will be playing against, in a sort of battle.
You’ll have several skills, items and upgrades to unlock with the gold you win after each battle. On steam the game is censored but that can be solved by downloading the uncensored version, there’s a guide for it.

First of all let me say that I don’t buy Hentai games, I already had Mirror 2, which was massively downvoted because it didn’t have sexual content like the first one, and the backers felt betrayed, and I guess that’s fair. So I got Mirror 1, and the required DLC, lost shards to get all the achievements, because I was really curious to see what the sexual content was.

And oh boy, it makes all the lewdness in Mirror 2 feel very tame.

Each character has a background story, voiced in japanese and with English subtitles, and after each episode you have a battle to fight, four in total. After these battles, you unlock the endgame content, which is a sort of MK “finish her” moment but with sex instead of mutilation, which will lead to a “good” ending and a bad ending. 

If you’re a normal person, these character endings will be disturbing most of the time, with only a few exceptions, and a few cute, sexy or even heartwarming moments, but again, most stories revolve around things like r*ape, assault, incest, torture… I think no taboo or kink was left behind.
 
The backgrounds are well drawn and the characters are distinct from each other and have small animations like the chest breathing and slight movements. The interface and game board is also well designed. The sound effects are what you would expect, so a lot of moaning and screaming. 

The gameplay is the strong suite of the game. Each character has different abilities and strategies, some play defensively until the time runs out, others are more aggressive and force you to play defensively. But if you’re making a lot of 4 and 5 piece combinations you can win against any of them rather easily, especially after you’re bought the best skills and items. 

[b]Achievements:[/b]  
[b]How many:[/b] 114 Achievements.
[b]How much time:[/b] Around 9 hours.
[b]Game difficulty:[/b] Easy. The first battles can be won on your first or second tries, but at some point you’ll need to farm a little more to unlock the items and skills you need to beat the harder characters. 
[b]Achievements’ Difficulty:[/b] Medium. You'll need the base game and Lost Shards DLC.
Most achievements are for completing the stories and both ending. In the end of a normal run, I only had a few left: beating some characters in less than 25 rounds, buying some upgrades, and having 200 fury. This last won can be obtained by farming 100 fury, or using the pepper item to give you an extra 20 fury, and then matching 3 diamonds to get the extra 100. These might seem difficult but with the right upgrades and items I got it in my 4th or 5th try.

[b]Overall opinion:[/b]  
Mirror is an Hentai match 3 game with a lot of disturbing content that you probably should avoid, especially if you’re young.[b] I’m only recommending it for the gameplay[/b], which is complex and fun to play, but Mirror 2 is probably a better choice still.

Mirror is a game where Candy Crush and adult content mix and match to form a fair game. I am reviewing the game assuming anyone reading will download the 18+ patch.

The stories for mirror is pretty nice. They don't overstay their welcome, and are often enough to keep me interested. They are, however short, occasionally have spelling errors, and may not be on par with bigger titles since the story is more decentralized across characters.

Gameplay is basic, but fun for a game this cheap. The skills are enough to provide a fun bit of diversity until late game repetition start to gnaw away the desire to continue. Mirror isn't easy late game, and upgrading skills is important, especially the second series of characters such as Hill or Madoka.

The adult content, however, I find not suited for my tastes. I won't downgrade the rating based on the content, but the lack of variety. Most scenes are forceful on behalf of many of the male characters. I can name three or four instances where I got something refreshing where the game accidentally showed the lady on top. The scenes with the character allow you to either play story or free play with three objects to use on your waifu of choice. The scenes option is pretty nice to access, although the scenes, themselves could use more work. The pleasure/pain bar is the biggest praise, since it adds some dynamic element to what you do, albeit not much. After all, there's a good and bad ending, bringing the game above Nekopara. The endings; however, make me question the sanity. I have seen some things, but I have never thought I'd see childbirth, water sports, and in the worst case, gore. The last element came from the same lady who had a childbirth, and warned me of disturbing imagery, which I thought was the childbirth. I was so far off, I ended up paying my soul and sanity for something I'd rather not discuss. Mirror is pretty alright, but I wish there were warnings with descriptions for anything beyond vanilla which I discussed.

The art, SFX, and music make up the final portion of the section. The music is great. It slaps. Each character, I remember have their theme and it's nice to not have the repetition of the same couple of tracks. Art is also amazing, you can see some fan art and even cosplay from DLCs, something I love the devs have done. It's refreshing to see a company acknowledge fan art. Sound effect get the shortest end, especially adult sounds and voice acting. Everything else is fine. Madoka's voice is distorted, the milf Harry Potter lady is a little off and a bit quiet, though I think she should have a second take on a lot of dialogue. The SFX for the adult scenes for the "finishing moments" are just awful. The VA is nice in the section and at least help to distract from the sounds.

My closing statements: hold of until sale. Avoid if you want less forceful scenes. I think it's fair to give this game a 75/100 since there isn't too much innovation and the lack of warning around sensitive moments took off some steam. The price and developers are what makes this game a yes on my part despite the adult content being a more important thing to grade on my behalf.

122768155.review:
this appeals to no target audience. none.

candy crush game-play is cancelled out by the lewd art
lewd art cancelled out by some of the most unappealing censorship I've ever seen. like, its so bad its funny.
VN "choices matter" type ""story"" cancelled out by the fact you don't give a flying **** what happens to any of the characters in the game because they're utterly hollow.

there is no story. things happen to people and you don't know why or even care why. this game broke the 4th wall without even trying. once upon a time, the devs and all involved might have cared about this game. the artists certainly have talent; the burning Kyoto scene makes that blatantly obvious. the composer cared and has talent but set the mood in such a way that it foreshadowed heavy emotions, like they were warning us our hearts were about to be broken by a story that was so rich in despair, it would leave a grown man crying... but.. there was no story. 

robinhood elf? OK cool premise bro but i didn't see the starving kids they were helping. i didn't care that i called her out for being of noble birth and stealing from others when her own wealth would have sufficed.
shrine maiden exorcist? yeah idc if you're the good girl. idc if i force you to do what i made you to do. idc what happens to a city when i haven't seen anyone in it.

the author made no effort to make the characters feel alive. the game even has at least 1 bug. 

to sum it up. its a 3/10 only because the artist is good and the composer made some good tracks, albeit wasting their talent on this game. 

i'm not usually one to be so harsh but the author has no business being in the creative media sector. nor do they have any business being in business. their characters felt empty, the world was empty. an adult that has read a book or played a game or watched TV should have at least some idea how to write a story that inspires SOMETHING within their audience. as for the target audience, well I've spent enough time on this review but an intentionally story-less lewd puzzle game would have been better than this. lewds 4 simpletons would have been more successful. i would have preferred a game with no story, by design, than this.

122154909.review:
Mirror is a Match-3 RPG style strategy game that carries the story through the use of visual novel elements.  Artwork is done by KAGAMI WORKs and Paradise Project which features 8 different short stories that are viewed through a magic mirror. Starting with the dark elf Daisy, a different monster or character will fight the specific female character through the end of each story arc. The magic mirror will reveal more female characters after reaching the end of each story arc.


The story revolves around the following characters:

Daisy: A dark elf who steals from the rich to give to the poor.
Yoko: An archer and priestess of a shrine in Kyoto who defends the city from monsters.
Cai Yun: A Chinese zombie who lies sealed inside a cave and awaits the return of the next reincarnation of her former lover and fellow disciple.
Lin: An ice dragon who serves a family of dragon knights as the family's maid. 
Unita: An orc she-warrior who has to hunt and slay a ferocious monster to be recognized as a warrior in her tribe.
Ketsuno Ana: A shogun girl from ancient Japan who somehow ended up at a modern Comicon (anime exhibition for otakus) and was mistaken for a cosplayer. 
Ebony (Augie Terry): A queen of the Empire of Yellow Sand with grand ambitions to attain divinity at all costs.
Martha: A nun who works at a convent to distribute food to the needy and spreading god's message.

118446741.review:
[h1] Mirror: Perdido en tus reflejos [/h1]
Reseña completa en: [url=https://scesp.blogspot.com/2022/07/mirror-perdido-en-tus-reflejos.html]  [/url]

  Desde que Candy Crush revolucionó el mundo, no ha habido año que no tuvieramos un centenar de match-3 para jugar. No es que Candy Crush me apasione, pero hay que reconocer que el match-3 engancha. Lo que nadie se esperaba es que este tipo de jugabilidad iba a ganar tanto al juntarlo con juegos eroge. El primero que lo demostró fue Hunie Pop, citas con gran variedad de chicas y contenido ecchi cómo recompensa por el esfuerzo de resolver estos puzzles: este juego hizo furor, merecido. 

Tras el triunfo de este último título la historia se repite, y actualmente podemos encontrar centenares de juegos match-3 + eroge, y de toda esa variedad de títulos destacamos el título que nos ocupa: Mirror desarrollado por Kagami Works.

 Tal cómo os habéis imaginado por la introducción la jugabilidad de Mirror también está basada en match-3. El juego consta de 8 historias (12, si tenemos en cuenta el DLC), cada una de ellas involucrando a una mujer. En cada una de ellas, a través de 3 capítulos de novela visual se nos presenta a la coprotagonista y a nuestro alter-ego en cuestión, al final de cada capítulo tendremos que realizar una elección que aumentará o disminuirá los stats de nuestra contrincante en la batalla de match-3, tras la cual entraremos en la misma.

 La batalla tratará de disminuir a 0 la barra de nuestra adversaria antes de que ella haga lo propio con la nuestra. Para ello contaremos con varios tipos de gemas y de objetos. Las gemas de espada ejecutarán un ataque físico, las gemas estrella lanzarán un ataque mágico, las bolas naranja aumentarán nuestra ira (que potenciará nuestro ataque y curaciones) y las pociones nos restaurarán salud. Para trigerear cualquiera de estos efectos tendremos que juntar en horizontal o en vertical por lo menos 3 de dichas gemas, juntar más de dichas gemas provocará efectos especiales basando en el tipo de gema y en la build que nos hayamos construido (además de poder dañar la ropa de nuestra contrincante, reduciendo su defensa pero aumentando su ataque.... y las partes expuestas de su cuerpo). A esto le añadimos los objetos con los que nos podemos equipar al comienzo de la batalla, que nos aportarán beneficios sin consumir nuestro turno pero consumiendose en el proceso. Por su parte, nuestra contrincante contará con una serie de ataques y habilidades único que no solo hará mella en nuestra salud sino que será capaz de cambiar el tablero y las reglas del juego, tornandose cada combate en una situación única.

El resultado de cada encuentro será valorado y proporcionalmente a la valoración se nos entregará dinero con el que podremos aumentar nuestros stats, comprar objetos o desbloquear nuevas habilidades. Está pequeña parte de RPG nos permitirá personalizar las habilidades de nuestro luchador para adecuarlo mejor a nuestras contrincantes. 

Es sorprendete cómo una propuesta de jugabilidad tan simple puede llegar a alcanzar estos niveles de personalización y de juego estratégico, los cuales tendremos que dominar (y dominaremos) para subyugar a las contricantes más duras.

Una vez superado los 3 capitulos podremos pasar a mantener relaciones sexuales con la protagonista de cada capítulo, la manera en lo que lo hagamos aumentara el placer o el dolor de la protagonista, desbloqueando cada uno de ellos dos finales distintos. En este caso estaremos hablando de eventos interactivos hentai totalmente doblados y una escena final tras finalizarlos. También tendremos disponible una última batalla, más difícil que las anteriores, si queremos seguir desafiándola.

No todas las historias van a tener la misma calidad narrativa, siendo cuatro o cinco las más sobresalientes. Sin embargo, es de admirar el estilo artístico de todos los CGs y CGs animados del juego, tendremos material de alta calidad para "relajarnos". 117091342.review:
This game saved my life.

I am 27.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

Much Yum. Surprising amount of Plot. And one of the most satisfying Match-Three games I've ever played, and I've played an unhealthy amount of those.

I know the second one's out already, but the OG deserves it's due praise.

Firstly, it's pretty. Really pretty. They put effort into graphics and it's greatly appreciated. 
Then there's audio. Every girl is individually voice-acted, including the x-rated scenes you get when you finish the full story lines. 
Then you get the girls themselves. Each one is unique, with their own motivations, story lines and quirks. Some you like, some you dislike and some you would gladly take several virtual bullets for. They are as plentiful as their plot-lines.

The base game is censored, but there are some simple mods in the community hub to fix that. It's worth it.

If you just want the yum, it's a quick grind to unlock their endings. Install the mod and have a very good time.
If you want the plot, each girl has two possible endings. You don't have to unlock both to feel accomplished, but it's a nice challenge.
If you're here for the match-three mechanics, there's a battle button. Click it and play one match with several girls. Over and over, to your heart's delight. If you die, just restart. The girls are on shuffle and get harder as the tournament progresses. You can match whatever, but strategy is actually a factor and can really make you think at times. 

Honestly can't remember if I paid for this or not, but I hope I did. The devs deserve every penny.

PS: Wear headphones

[b] TLDR: [/b]
Mirror is extremely cheap, has great voice acting and good character design. It's also really fucked up.

First of all, why should you care what I think? I have played Mirror for about 15 hours, gotten every single achievement and taken a good hour to write this review. Although I most likely don't have to tell you this, this review is subjective to my experiences with the game, others might think differently.
 
[b] Strong Points [/b] 
With that out of the way, let's get started with the games strong points as if you aren't interested in any of these the game is most definitely not for you.

[list]
    [*]The game is very cheap, costing only 2 euro.
    [*]The voice acting is great and was the best part in my opinion, The voice actors portrayed their characters well.
    [*]The game looks pretty damn impressive with unique character designs which are further enhanced by the characters personalities.
    [*]The game is rather tame fetish wise, more about it during the drawbacks.
[/list]

Overall the game is enjoyable. Each of the 8 + (4 DLC) characters has their own story, ranging from a draconic maid tending to her master and a school girl succubus doing succubus things. The gameplay is split into two parts, the "interactive story" which is just a visual novel, complete with fake choices and all. The other is the combat gamemode which you need to beat to advance the story. Though it is not the most interesting since it's basically just a worse Candy Crush it does feature some nice eye candy on the side. Finally, there's the sex scenes. Honestly speaking, they are completely fine, they are what I would call pseudo interactive. You choose a tool and click on the girl's body, then an animation plays, the girl moans and then it stops. It's what it's, no more no less.

[b] Downsides [/b] 
Now then let's talk about the downsides.

[list]
    [*]The game is not at all tame with its fetishes, I'm sorry I lied earlier, but I'll explain why in a bit.
    [*]Gameplay can become extremely difficult depending on which girl you are facing.
    [*]Luck plays a massive role in this game.
[/list]

Let's start with the fetish paradox. Earlier I said that the game is rather tame and that is true, depending on which sex scene you choose. You see Mirror sex scenes are divided into two categories which you can choose after defeating a girl 3 times. The first is Pleasure, in which everything is sunshine and rainbows. The girl gets their hole(s) filled and the current main character gets their heart filled, how sweet. However, there is another option and this is where it gets a bit darker.

114953400.review:
I am not a fan of battle match 3 games but I did enjoy this one! 

So… not being familiar with battle match 3's, the learning curve was steep for me and I ended up doing a lot of grinding to upgrade skills, potions, etc. The game would definitely benefit from at the very least a document-type tutorial for beginners. I stumbled into several areas of the game and had a hard time finding them again later. But even when I did, I was unsure how to continue so just skipped them.

To be able to play the two endings for each girl, 3 battles must be won first. Each battle is preceded by a story. If the battle is lost, the story is repeated and I didn't find any way to skip the repeated story except with an auto-clicker. In the beginning the stories for the girls were interesting and entertaining although long. But with 12 girls to battle (8 in the original game and 4 in the DLC), the stories became boring and at times confusing.

I enjoyed the match 3 battles much more than the rest of the game. Of the 25+ hours I played so far, I would guess maybe one quarter was actual match 3 game play. The rest were stories and mini-games.

There are other better match 3 games available but if you are into battle match 3’s and or story-driven games, it is a decent game at a decent price. However if you are also into Steam Achievements, “Mirror: The Last Shards” DLC is required to get all the achievements. And for Steam badge collectors, trading cards are available...As an added bonus (strictly your own personal preference)… there is an uncensored version of the game which can be turned on or off in the options!

114460967.review:
A Dark Elf thief sneaks into a castle in search for valuables. A dragon girl struggles to come to terms with her awakening powers. An Egyptian noble wants a clear path to divinity. Mirror is comprised of eight, non-connected stories about women and the sex they have with particular men and/or entities. At the start of the game, all characters except the thief are locked and can only be made accessible by playing through each character’s personal story. Their narratives are largely told through visual novel-style cutscenes that play out across three episodes. The stories here aren’t what you might call “high art,” however they serve as a wonderful excuse to put eight sexy women in hot costumes.

If you’ve played any variant of Bejeweled over the years, then you’re more than equipped to handle what Mirror has to offer. The conflict between the character and their antagonist are played out in a match-three style manner similar to HuniePop. Gameplay involves matching like versions of four gem types that have different offensive and defensive properties. Green bottles restore health to the player, a pair of crossed swords deals physical damage, purple stars trigger magic damage, and orange spheres add rage which adds the strength to physical and magical attacks. The nature of these attacks can be changed by purchasing upgrades in the store that are designed to increase the strength of the attack as well as trigger a special effect, like an auto-heal ability that lasts for a specific number of rounds. On top of that, there are bonuses for matching four and five gems. Four gems create a special upgrade that when matched against others of its kind, yields a nice little boost to the overall effect. A five gem chain creates a diamond that does serious damage to your opponent’s overall health.

Your opponent doesn’t play directly off the board like you do. Instead, they will attack using a repertoire of moves that do physical damage or influence the gems by making them inaccessible or take them over. Some of their skills are a little more nefarious. The Egyptian noble, for example, can place a snake gem at the top of a column that triggers a strong physical attack every three rounds. The only way to get rid of it is to move the piece off the board by eliminating the gems directly underneath it. Investing money in your character traits and special items that can negate or suspend the enemy’s abilities is essential for late game opponents equipped with larger health pools. On top of all that, you only get forty turns to defeat them, turning what is initially believed to be a porno delivery system into a pretty substantial and involved game.

Speaking of porn, the hentai-inspired nature of Mirror is likely to draw the majority of the attention. I freely admit that the porn is what drew me to it in the first place. It’s worth pointing out that Mirror is censored out of the box. During a battle, if you do enough damage, the woman’s costumes will rip and tear away revealing a pair of flowery pasties covering up their naughty bits. When you’ve fought through all three episodes of a character’s story, you’ll get to play an interactive sex scene where you use a collection of sex toys and other implements of pleasure (or pain) designed to bring the woman to climax. These scenes are also censored, featuring the same flower pasties and a weird, naked rabbit to cover up sexual organs. The censoring sucks but because this is a Steam title, it was expected. Thankfully, a short jaunt to the game’s community forum will provide an easy to follow roadmap towards a patch that removes the flowers and rabbits. After all, I feel this game was meant to be enjoyed fully uncensored.

What I love most about Mirror is the artwork. The sexy illustrations are a great reward for working your way through meaty gameplay (for a match-three game, at least). The art is in top form during the sex scenes, which are modeled after the character’s costumes and story. The shrine maiden arc, for example, ends with the character bound in shibari as per the requirements of a dark ritual she has been subjected to. These scenes allow the player to manipulate a series of objects design to inflict pleasure and pain, such as burning wax, feathers, tentacles, dildos, and good, old fashion penises. How much pleasure or pain you give yields one of two different endings, which is a great reason to go back and play with the girls again. There’s also a “free play” version that lets you do whatever you want without having to worry about points or trying to achieve different endings but you must fight the character a fourth time to unlock it. In free play, you can switch between clothed and naked versions of the characters, once again proving that the uncensored patch is the best way to take in these eight gorgeous ladies as they writhe and thrive on sex.

Mirror is loaded with great, sexy fun. The puzzle gameplay is solid and offers a lot of variation and nuance to keep things nice and challenging. It wants to make you work for your porn. The rewards are a collection of sexy art pieces and interactive scenes that play out in different ways. A game like this is easy to get wrong. The gameplay could suck and the rewards might not be worth the effort. In fact, I’d say the only thing the game doesn’t do all that well is the dialog featured in cut scenes. It’s not terrible but it’s not that great either. In the end, Mirror isn’t just a great way to find fantastic erotic illustrations, it’s also a pretty fun game to play.

Verdict: 8/10

Light that bounces off a mirror will show an image of whatever is in front of it, when focused through the lens of the eye or a camera. Mirrors reverse the direction of the image in an equal yet opposite angle from which the light shines upon it. This allows the viewer to see themselves or objects behind them, or even objects that are at an angle from them but out of their field of view, such as around a corner. Natural mirrors have existed since prehistoric times, such as the surface of water, but people have been manufacturing mirrors out of a variety of materials for thousands of years, like stone, metals, and glass. In modern mirrors, metals like silver or aluminum are often used due to their high reflectivity, applied as a thin coating on glass because of its naturally smooth and very hard surface.[/spoiler]

Mirror is a tile match game with basic RPG elements, where you get a mirror which is a portal to other women's life, where you could know their story and experience them.

The game looks all good. The characters, background pictures and other illustrations are well made. Animations looks also fine for the game's price. I really enjoyed the game's music, it's surprisingly varied for all characters and situations. The controls are straight forward... you need to only use the mouse, so your other hand is free to use. The stories are nothing too serious at first, however there are a few which is quite interesting and has twists., not even mentioning the multiple endings. The game also got decent challenge, however when you realize the exploit of the game, it makes the game walk in a park. As an adult game, it's also works fine, it's illustrated all right.

However, the basic gameplay could be boring, however the game trying their best with the different abilities of the girls who you fight with, but at some point it could result boredom. Also, most of the stories has some kind of kinky feeling, which was a bit weird for me, not even mentioning some of the bizarre moments it has sometimes. Need to mention, that the game has censor, which you can go around it, but it looks a bit "interesting". The game also offer you choices in the stories, however it's not really change up the story, also the endings somewhat weird to get it, based on the intercourse you do, rather than the story choices you make.

But to be honest, Mirror is an all right game, trying to change it up the basic formula, offering multiple stories and characters, also having great visuals and audio, so I can recommend to give it a shot, even for the full price. I also can recommend The Lost Shards DLC to get.

111753634.review:
El tiburón ballena, el pez más grande del mar gracias a sus 12 metros o más, tiene un gran menú para elegir. Afortunadamente para la mayoría de las criaturas marinas (¡y para nosotros!), su comida favorita es el plancton. Capturan estas diminutas plantas y animales, junto a cualquier pez pequeño que pase por ah, con su colosal boca abierta mientras nadan cerca de la superficie del agua.

El tiburón ballena, al igual que el segundo pez más grande del planeta, el tiburón peregrino, se alimenta por filtración. Para comer, abre de par en par sus enormes mandíbulas y absorbe todo lo que está cerca. Después cierra la boca, expulsando y filtrando el agua por las agallas. Todo lo que quede dentro es ingerido por este tiburón gigante.

La cabeza aplanada del tiburón ballena luce un hocico romo sobre su boca, con pequeñas barbas que sobresalen de las fosas nasales. Su dorso y laterales son entre grises y pardos, con manchas blancas entre rayas pálidas verticales y horizontales, y el vientre es blanco. Sus dos aletas dorsales están orientadas hacia la parte trasera de su cuerpo, que termina con una gran cola o aleta caudal bifurcada.

Como prefieren las aguas cálidas, los tiburones ballena están presentes en todos los mares tropicales. Se sabe que migra cada primavera a la plataforma continental de la costa oeste central de Australia. La reproducción del coral del Arrecife de Ningaloo, situado en esa zona, ofrece al tiburón ballena plancton en abundancia.

Pese a su enorme tamaño, el tiburón ballena es un pez dócil que a veces permite que los buceadores naden agarrados a ellos. En la actualidad figura en la lista de especies vulnerables. Pese a ello, siguen siendo cazados en algunas partes de Asia, como Taiwán y Filipinas.

109708538.review:
My friends found out I own this game, all is lost, might as well review it. 

Most reviews I've seen are joking, I'll try to give a more in depth and serious review instead. Mirror is an H-game that combines various VN routes alongside Match-3 game play. There are eight story routes in the base game, each revolving around a specific girl. These include a dark elf thief, a dragon maid, and a shrine maiden. You progress through their story lines (of which vary in overall quality, but are all rather par for the course if you are familiar with anime or H content) in a VN format. After each major story beat (three per girl) there is a Match-3 "battle". This is the main game play content you'll encounter. 

In all honesty, Mirror's take on Match-3 is possibly the best and most flushed out of its kind that I've ever played. There are four kinds of gems to match. Health, Rage (Attack Power), and Magic and Physical Attack gems. In addition, there are items and skills you can buy to increase damage or diversify your move set. However, a unique twist that Mirror throws in is that the girls each have unique skills of their own, to either directly damage you or hamper your progress. These range from a skill that inflicts a big portion of damage upon you, to locking a section of the grid, or even nullifying the effect of a gem thus making matching them useless. These add depth and planning to the match-3 game play, something you don't really see anywhere else. They don't use their skills every turn, due to their power, there is a brief few turns between each skill use that gives you room to plan and move gems around. I sometimes find myself coming back to this game solely for this game play itself, rather than the *other* content that Mirror has. 

Now that I've covered the main game loop, onto delving into the H content. Honestly? Its just okay. Not to say its bad, though there are some aspects of certain story lines that some may be turned off from,  it just isn't for everybody. If you are a prolific man of culture, you're unlikely to bat an eye, though some may be blindsided by it, so be forewarned. Each girl has a good and bad end. Your VN decisions during the VN portions influence which you get. Different endings, different H scenes. I'd also like to add that this game came out before Steam allowed full NSFW content. But, instead of an 18+ patch or DLC like most games of the type, Mirror never had one. Regardless, the full patches are easily found online, so the full capabilities of the game isn't too hard to access. Still worth mentioning.

Closing thoughts...the music slaps. Both the instrumentals, lyrical pieces, and especially the main theme. Again, this game is of very high quality in many regards. The OST by itself *is* locked behind the Song of the Maidens DLC, but it, like the base game, is very cheap and often goes on sale for less than a dollar. Might review the other DLC later, but the OST is something I wanted to include in the main review. The art is nice too, though nothing groundbreaking, it is good for what it is and what it needs to be. All in all, Mirror is a diamond among the rough, a surprisingly fun gem of a game with good content. Keep in mind that most H games on Steam are of *VERY* low quality, so this was a joy to play in comparison. 

A 9/10 from me, would play and lower my reputation among my friends' eyes again.

This game saved my life.

I am 87.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ing minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

Today, I am close friend with my kids mother. We don't fight, or argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents, and friends.

I now have 3 kids. My third child is, wait for it, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my own separation, and we just stumbled in to each others life unexpectedly. We have been in a relationship for a year now, and are very happy together.

Moral of the story, you never know what life holds in store for you, and if I would have given up when all the odds were stacked against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you

107521616.review:
A match-3 game for the whole family, assuming that your family consists of you and a horny partner only.

It presents you with 8 girls (+4 from DLC), each with their own story divided into 3 segments. At the end of each segment you must make a choice and "fight" the girl in a match-3 game. The girl receives a bonus/penalty depending on your choice in the story. Inflicting "damage" during the fight will cause the girl's clothes to tear, resulting in joy and cheers.

After the 3rd victory you unlock the sexytiem, the final part of the story where you get to show how much of a degenerate you are. Depending on your choices here you unlock a good or a bad ending.

The stories are disconnected and frankly, very poorly written. They were more of a bore. Also, expect those crazy fetishes. The battles can get quite tactical, because each girl has different skills. You can also combine different skills and buy items and upgrades. This aspect of the game was awesomely done. The art is mostly good, there is an H-patch and the game can be played with one hand, but I didn't find it that compelling - whatever floats your boat tho, dude/dudette.

The achievements were greatly done, encouraging the player to explore different endings and strategies. No Linux port, but worked flawlessly via Steam Proton - thanks Valve!

106296735.review:
I mean, it's a Hentai game, let's get this out first.
     Having said that, I really enjoyed the game. It's a match-3 type of game, can't say anything but good things about that part because I really like that kind of puzzle. The colors are vibrant, there are different effects depending on what type of gems you matched, different sounds.

     There are twelve girls in total with the DLCs, each one of them has their own story. Some stories were actually kind of good with plot twists, the rest of them were just typical stories, some of them badly written that make no sense whatsoever. There are also a lot of typos in the dialogues.

     As I said each girl has their own story that you progress through and that has two endings, a good and a bad one.

     What I found interesting is that each girl has her own set of attacks/abilities. You can buy items to use that can make your fight much easier, but in order for that to really help you out in a battle you do need to read the attacks/abilities of the girls in order to know which item to use. There are also some perks that you can unlock after buying them that can also help you out.

     For the Hentai part, you're just pretty much punishing the girls using sex. Beware that it is kind of forced at first until you make the girl aroused and she wants it. Story wise you can either pick the pleasure route or the pain one.

     I don't have that much experience with Hentai games, apart from Huniepop I didn't play others, so Hentai wise I don't really know what to say. Puzzle wise I really enjoyed the game and I would've liked it a lot better if there were more levels and the girls scaled with you, because once I had enough money to buy the items/perks that I needed, the game became way too easy and I had to play without them in order to feel a challenge.
